fine_dining.name: Vollmers
signature_dishes: Tasting menus (5 or 8 courses) focused on seasonal Skåne ingredients, local terroir and traditional techniques.
fine_dining.atmosphere: Intimate, elegant with refined Nordic design
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book well in advance; specify dietary requirements when booking; wine pairings available
fine_dining.local_tips: Known for its elegant interpretation of Skåne cuisine with the region's best ingredients. Run by the Vollmer brothers, this is Malmö's most acclaimed fine dining experience.

fine_dining.name: Bloom in the Park
signature_dishes: Surprise tasting menu featuring creative dishes based on seasonal availability
No menu is provided – dining experience is based on trust and chef's creativity
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sophisticated yet relaxed, set in a beautiful park location
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book ahead, especially for weekends; share dietary preferences but prepare for surprises
fine_dining.local_tips: Known for its 'no menu' concept where dishes are completely up to the chef's inspiration; exciting dining experience for the adventurous.

fine_dining.name: Ambiance à Vindåkra
signature_dishes: Tasting menus focusing on local Skåne produce with French techniques
Dishes often feature refined presentations of regional specialties
fine_dining.atmosphere: Charming country setting in a restored farmhouse
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reservations essential; located outside the city (car needed)
fine_dining.local_tips: Set in the beautiful Skåne countryside; worth the trip for the combination of rural Swedish atmosphere and refined French-influenced cuisine.

fine_dining.name: Sture
signature_dishes: Seasonal tasting menu showcasing local ingredients and contemporary techniques
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sophisticated urban dining room with minimalist design
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book well in advance; offers an excellent wine program with rare vintages
fine_dining.local_tips: Offers a high-end dining experience with focus on quality ingredients and impeccable service; popular with both locals and visitors seeking a sophisticated experience.

casual_dining.name: Saltimporten Canteen
signature_dishes: Often includes fish, meat, and vegetable options
casual_dining.atmosphere: Industrial harbor setting, minimalist design, communal tables
casual_dining.booking_tips: Only open weekday lunches; get there before 12:00 to avoid lines; unique harbor location.
casual_dining.local_tips: A Malmö institution famous for serving only one perfectly executed lunch dish each day; frequented by creative professionals and food lovers.

casual_dining.name: Bastard
casual_dining.atmosphere: Lively, urban bistro with open kitchen and rustic-chic decor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Popular spot, booking advised; good for sharing multiple dishes.
casual_dining.local_tips: Known for its nose-to-tail cooking philosophy and bold flavors; has a devoted following for its unpretentious yet refined approach to food.

casual_dining.name: Lyran Matbar
signature_dishes: Constantly changing menu based on market availability
Focus on vegetables and local producers
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy, intimate neighborhood spot with a casual vibe
casual_dining.booking_tips: Small place with limited seating; excellent natural wine selection.
casual_dining.local_tips: Beloved by locals for its honest, produce-driven cooking and convivial atmosphere; focus on sustainability and organic ingredients.

casual_dining.name: Julie
casual_dining.atmosphere: Stylish yet comfortable bistro with warm service
casual_dining.booking_tips: Great date spot; good for both casual and special occasions.
casual_dining.local_tips: Strikes a perfect balance between casual and refined dining; known for consistent quality and welcoming atmosphere.

street_food.name: Malmö Falafel (Various Stands)
specialties: Falafel Wrap: Freshly fried falafel balls in pita with tahini, vegetables, pickles, and hot sauce.
Falafel Plate: Served with hummus, salad, and bread.
street_food.location: Throughout the city, especially Möllevången district (e.g., Jalla Jalla, Möllans Falafel)
street_food.local_tips: Malmö is famous for its falafel thanks to its large Middle Eastern community. The city's signature street food, affordable and delicious.

street_food.name: Malmö Saluhall
specialties: Various food stalls offering everything from Nordic tapas to Asian fusion
Pink Head Noodle Bar (ramen and Asian dishes)
street_food.location: Gibraltargatan (Malmö's food hall in a converted warehouse)
street_food.local_tips: Modern food hall with high-quality vendors in an attractive industrial setting. Good option for groups who want different types of food.

street_food.name: Malmö Street Food Market
street_food.hours: Varies by season (check social media for current times/location)
street_food.location: Various locations depending on season (often at Folkets Park in summer)
street_food.local_tips: Seasonal market bringing together diverse food trucks; good for sampling different cuisines in one place.

coffee_shops.name: Solde Kaffebar
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Bright, minimalist Scandinavian design with warm touches
coffee_shops.local_tips: One of Malmö's best specialty coffee shops, focusing on quality beans and skilled preparation.

coffee_shops.name: Lilla Kafferosteriet
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Cozy, traditional café with its own roastery
coffee_shops.food_options: Full range of pastries, sandwiches, light meals
coffee_shops.local_tips: One of Malmö's oldest and most beloved coffee shops. The connected roastery ensures freshness.

coffee_shops.name: Jord
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Bright, plant-filled space with sustainability focus
coffee_shops.food_options: Extensive plant-based menu, salads, bowls, sandwiches
coffee_shops.local_tips: Popular with health-conscious locals. Great spot for vegetarians and vegans.

coffee_shops.name: St. Jakobs Stenugnsbageri
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Rustic bakery atmosphere with view of the baking process
coffee_shops.best_time: Morning for fresh bread, afternoon for fika
coffee_shops.food_options: Bread, pastries, sandwiches, simple lunch options
coffee_shops.local_tips: One of the city's best bakeries with stone oven-baked bread. Worth visiting for the smells alone!

bars.name: Mineral
signature_drinks: Rotating selection of natural, organic, and biodynamic wines
Focus on small producers and unusual varieties
bars.atmosphere: Minimalist, stylish space with knowledgeable staff
bars.food_options: Well-paired small plates featuring local ingredients
bars.local_tips: Malmö's premier natural wine destination. Staff are happy to guide you through the often-challenging world of natural wines.

bars.name: Malmö Brewing Co & Taproom
signature_drinks: Wide range of house beers from IPAs to stouts
bars.atmosphere: Industrial taproom connected to working brewery
bars.food_options: Beer-friendly food menu including burgers, wings
bars.local_tips: Malmö's largest craft brewery with excellent beers brewed on-site. Good for groups.

bars.name: Belle Époque
bars.local_tips: Sophisticated spot for expertly made cocktails in a beautiful setting. One of Malmö's most elegant bars.

bars.name: Far i Hatten
bars.atmosphere: Relaxed beer garden in an historic wooden pavilion in Folkets Park
bars.local_tips: Beautiful outdoor setting in warmer months. A Malmö institution for relaxed drinks and people-watching.

food_tours.name: Malmö Food Walk
highlights: Sampling Middle Eastern, Nordic, and fusion cuisines
Visiting key food spots including Malmö Saluhall and Möllevången
Learning about the city's diverse food culture
food_tours.booking_tips: Great introduction to Malmö's diverse food scene. Wear comfortable shoes.

cooking_classes.name: Skåne Regional Cooking Class
what_you_learn: Both traditional recipes and modern interpretations
includes: Hands-on cooking, local ingredients, recipes, meal featuring the prepared dishes
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Excellent way to understand the regional specialties. Book through cooking schools or local chefs offering workshops.

markets.name: Malmö Saluhall
highlights: Artisanal food vendors under one roof
Mix of restaurants, cafés, and food shops
Converted industrial building with stylish design
markets.hours: Typically 10 AM - 7 PM (check specific vendor hours)
markets.local_tips: Malmö's premier food hall. Great for lunch with options for everyone or buying specialty products. Clean, modern space.

markets.name: Möllevångstorget Market
highlights: Affordable produce from around the world
markets.local_tips: Heart of Malmö's diverse food scene. Great prices and selection. Surrounding streets have excellent international grocery stores.

markets.name: Street Food Market at Folkets Park
highlights: Rotating selection of food trucks and stalls
markets.hours: Seasonal (primarily summer), typically afternoons and evenings
markets.local_tips: Popular summer destination for casual dining. Check park website for current schedule and vendors.

spring: Fresh herbs and spring greens from local farms
summer: Skåne Strawberries (Jordgubbar) - known throughout Sweden for their quality
Summer vegetables from the fertile Skåne region
autumn: Apple dishes (Skåne is Sweden's apple region)
Eel (Ål) - traditional Skåne specialty (seasonal restrictions apply)
winter: Julbord (Christmas Buffet) - with Skåne regional specialties
Gåsamiddag (Goose Dinner) - traditional in Skåne, especially around November 10th (Saint Martin's Day)
Spettekaka - unique Skåne pyramid-shaped dessert made with eggs and sugar
Semlor (cardamom buns filled with almond paste and whipped cream) before Lent
